kernfrasen: paid down on a new mink coat
placing our feet on solid ground

doeldomein.theologisch_concept: The Holy Spirit and Eschatological Completion

cognitieve_implicaties: The deal is legally binding but not yet physically complete
The owner has a right to the item even if it is not in their house yet
theologische_implicaties: Pneumatology as a guarantee of future glory

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'dead' biblical metaphor of 'earnest' by using the contemporary retail concept of 'Will Call' and 'mink coats'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon is tightly bound by the Economic domain. Even the discussion of predestination is framed as a 'schedule' or 'decree' (administrative/legal), which fits the contract theme.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: Contracts require conscious legal agreement; infections are involuntary biological processes.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'Will Call' pickup is framed as the moment of 'eternal health,' resolving the 'fever of life'.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the archaic KJV term 'earnest' and makes it cognitively accessible through the 'Will Call' department.
sterktes.voorbeeld: I must go to 'Will Call' and pick it up... Well, the Lord has paid down on us.

risicos.beschrijving: Comparing a human soul to a mink coat in a store risks reducing the imago dei to a luxury good.
risicos.voorbeeld: she paid down on a new mink coat... Well, the Lord has paid down on us.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Devaluation of human agency and personhood.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A bustling Mediterranean marketplace/modern retail store.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High - grounds the abstract in the 'street where we live'.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Through the repetition of 'purchased possession' and 'claiming' language.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Using the 'crossing the street' analogy to show the absurdity of pure fatalism.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits a standard evangelical 'call to witness' and 'assurance' liturgy.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in the Economic Domain. It successfully bridges the gap between 1st-century 'earnest money' and 20th-century retail. However, it leans heavily on the 'transactional' nature of faith, which can occasionally feel impersonal.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'Infection' metaphor—it is a powerful living metaphor that counters the coldness of the 'Contract' metaphor.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Describe the 'warmth' of the infection spreading through a cold room.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Link them via the concept of 'Possession'—just as a virus possesses a body, the Spirit possesses the life purchased in the contract.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Objects have no say in being bought.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Explicitly state that unlike the coat, the human 'possession' must 'trust' and 'believe' to enter the contract.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the 'transactional' feel with 'growth' and 'organic life'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A brilliant use of CMT to bridge cultural gaps. The 'Will Call' analogy is a homiletical home run for cognitive retention.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the 'mink coat' story for its vividness; CMT reveals it maps the Holy Spirit to a financial deposit.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Kolb would focus on the 'experience' of the barbershop; CMT focuses on how the 'barbershop' source domain structures the 'predestination' target domain.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher is 'baptizing' the commercial domain to overwrite the 'fatalism' schema of the congregation.

appendices.notities: Preacher uses 'homespun' language to de-escalate the tension of high-calvinist terminology.
